And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

15.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
15.str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

15.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
15.str2: To dwell as in a tent, encamp, have my tabernacle. From skenos; to tent or encamp, i.e. to occupy or, to reside.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

15.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
15.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

16.str2: No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

16.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
16.str2: To be hungry, needy, desire earnestly. From the same as penes; to famish; figuratively, to crave.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

16.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
16.str2: To thirst for, desire earnestly. From a variation of dipsos; to thirst for.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.

16.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
16.str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

16.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
16.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Burning heat, heat. From kaio; properly, a burn, but used of a glow.

17.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.
A primary preposition and adverb; properly, up; but used severally, or at.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From thrao; a stately seat; by implication, power or a potentate.

17.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

17.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: To lead, guide; met: I instruct, teach. From hodegos; to show the way (teach).

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
17.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A fountain, spring, well, issue, flow. Probably from pegnumi; a fount, i.e. Source or supply.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
Water. And genitive case, hudatos, etc. From the base of huetos; water literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

17.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
17.str2: To plaster, wash over; I wipe off, wipe out, obliterate. From ek and aleipho; to smear out, i.e. Obliterate.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

17.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
17.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
